list_definition.definition: (with thator on) to state, emphasize, or hold firmly to (an opinion, plan etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He insists that I was to blame for the accident
I insisted on driving him home.

list_definition.definition: (often with onor that) to demand or urge

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She insisted on coming with me
He insisted that I should go.

list_ex_of_english: Although their methods were similar, he insisted, they were reached by different paths.
In contrast, the woman's lawyer claimed the regularization of the marriage, and insisted that his client was perfectly able to conclude marriage on her own.
Despite their waning interest in genuine political reform, however, donors have continued to insist on nominally democratic systems.
For a similar reason we also insist that there must be at least one lambda.
Should they insist that workers have an "affirmative" right to better work conditions, a right that superseded their employers' freedom to contract?
I insisted on bringing in utility and production functions because, once again, it is very hard to analyze credibility problems starting from ad-hoc demand functions.
They might insist, that is, that there are only negative duties and permissions, so that all acts of aid are supererogator y, not obligatory.
Finally, the author insists that there should be a common syntactic analysis of these so-called operators, though it is rather unclear why.
